page.title: 04EDEN VALLEY AGRICULTURE
page.content: The area is classified as mainly{Rough {Grazing}but this would annoy the local farmers as it is really carefully managed{Permanent Pasture. On this grassland{sheep and cattle} (mainly Fresian dairy cows and crossbred sheep for breeding or meat) graze in hedged fields. {Crops}are mainly turnips,barley and grass to feed stock but potatoes are grown for human consumption. Increasingly, oilseed rape is grown. {Market Gardening}used to be important, started by the Land Settlement Association but is now virtually ceased. The smallholdings with their characteristic Dutch style houses are now almost all owned by families not engaged in horticulture. Small-scale{Forestry}(mainly hardwood) takes advantage of earlier estate plantings.
